intro: Kibara kostermansii, commonly known as the Kibara tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, where it forms part of the understory vegetation. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential pharmacological applications.
